original: CHRISTENSON, N Y E, Kapten, Göteborg, f Vadmöllan, Malmöh l, 5/9 82 av riksdagsm C J C o h h. Lunds katedralsk, internatsk, styrmans-, ångbåtsbefälh- o sjökapt.ex 06, hdlsinst Hamburg 12, hdlssk London; resuoff flottan 07, ljt 15, kapt 23, adj bevakningsch Gbgs distr 16—18. Till sjöss 99, tjg öl red- o skpsmklkont, ch Cosinoramabol Gbg 20, sousch Sv Filmindustris Sthlmsbiografer 22, vkst dir Fastigh AB Orion Gbg (ag av Palladiumbio o ds fastigh) 23, pens ss vkst dir Palladiumkoncernen 42. Resor: Canada, USA, Sydam, Sydafr, Kina, Japan mfl. C var bl a med när ångf Silvertown 02 lade ned första telegrafkabeln över Stilla havet mell San Francisco o Honolulu.
translated: CHRISTENSON, N Y E, Captain, Gothenburg, born in Vadmöllan, Malmö County, on September 5, 1882, the son of Member of Parliament C J C and h h. Attended Lund Cathedral School, boarding school, received degrees as mate, steamboat officer, and ship captain in 1906. Completed trade education in Hamburg in 1912 and trade school in London. Served in the Navy from 1907, promoted to lieutenant in 1915, and to captain in 1923. Served as adjutant in the surveillance police of the Gothenburg district from 1916 to 1918. Worked at sea from 1899, employed in various shipping and shipbuilding companies. Became managing director of Cosinoramabol in Gothenburg in 1920, and of Sv Filmindustris Sthlmsbiografer in 1922. Became managing director of Fastigh AB Orion in Gothenburg (owner of Palladium Cinema and related properties) in 1923. Retired as managing director of Palladiumkoncernen in 1942. Traveled to Canada, USA, South America, South Africa, China, Japan, and more. C was, among other things, involved when the steamship Silvertown laid down the first telegraph cable across the Pacific Ocean between San Francisco and Honolulu in 1902.

structured.name: CHRISTENSON, N Y E

organization.name: Surveillance Police of the Gothenburg district

notableAchievement: Participated in laying down the first telegraph cable across the Pacific Ocean between San Francisco and Honolulu onboard the steamship Silvertown in 1902.
